```{r, echo=FALSE, include=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
```

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r}
data = as.tbl(read.csv("student-por.csv", sep=";", stringsAsFactors=TRUE))
```

###Rename the Variables

```{r}

rename_cols <- c(4:12,16:21,23:24,26:28,31:33)

colnames(data)[rename_cols] = c("urban_rural",
                                "fam_size",
                                "parents_cohabit",
                                "mom_edu",
                                "dad_edu",
                                "mom_job",
                                "dad_job",
                                "school_reason",
                                "student_guardian",
                                "extra_school_support",
                                "fam_edu_support",
                                "paid_extra_classes",
                                "extracurricular_activities",
                                "attended_nursery",
                                "wants_higher_education",
                                "has_romantic_partner",
                                "family_relationship",
                                "going_out_amount",
                                "weekday_alcohol_cons",
                                "weekend_alcohol_cons",
                                "grade_one",
                                "grade_two",
                                "final_grade")
```

```{r}
lm_sex <- lm(final_grade ~ sex, data = data)

summary(lm_sex)

```

The average grade for females  is 12.25 whereas the average grade for Males is 11.40. The difference between the two is signifcant (p < 0.001); the R-squared is 0.015.
